conclusion: Determine the mechanical energy loss during the collision between block C and block B.
Block C slides on the skateboard with an initial velocity v_0 and experiences friction over a distance s_0.
The work done by friction is W = -μmg s_0.
The work done by friction equals the change in kinetic energy of block C: 1/2 mv_0^2 - 1/2 mv_C^2 = -μmg s_0.
Solving for v_C gives v_C = sqrt(v_0^2 + 2μgs_0).
Since the collision is perfectly inelastic, blocks C and B stick together after the collision.
Using conservation of momentum, the velocity of the combined system after the collision is v_f = v_C/2.
Initial kinetic energy of block C just before the collision is K_i = 1/2 m (v_0^2 + 2μgs_0).
Final kinetic energy of the combined system after the collision is K_f = m (v_0^2 + 2μgs_0)/4.
The mechanical energy loss ΔE is the difference between the initial and final kinetic energies: ΔE = K_i - K_f.
The mechanical energy loss during the collision is ΔE = m (v_0^2 + 2μgs_0)/4.
